Catalog.ResourceDescription.Name: crisma-openlayers
Catalog.ResourceDescription.Author: Manuel Warum
Catalog.ResourceDescription.Description: Basic OpenLayers widget using OpenStreetMap tiles. Data, imagery and map information provided by OpenStreetMap and contributors, CC-BY-SA

Preference.name: recenter
Preference.description: Automatically re-center the map whenever it changed through events
Preference.label: Auto re-center

InputEndpoint.name: view_point
InputEndpoint.label: Coordinates
InputEndpoint.description: Focuses the map on specified coordinates
InputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This is an endpoint that accepts a JSON-encoded object with latitude and longitude coordinate data. When coordinates are received (WGS 1984 projection), the map will pan to the location represented by it.

InputEndpoint.name: add_point
InputEndpoint.label: Add point
InputEndpoint.description: Adds a point to the map
InputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This is an endpoint that accepts a JSON-encoded object with latitude and longitude coordinate data and a unique identifier. The object will be added to the map view. If the recenter preference is set to true, the map will then pan to the newly added object.

InputEndpoint.name: add_line
InputEndpoint.label: Add line
InputEndpoint.description: Adds a line to the map
InputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This endpoint allows the creation of line segments by providing an array of tuples containing latitude-longitude coordinate pairs.

InputEndpoint.name: add_poly
InputEndpoint.label: Add polygon
InputEndpoint.description: Adds a polygon to the map
InputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This endpoint allows the creation of polygons (without holes). It accepts an array of tuples containing latitude-longitude coordinate pairs that will form the outline of the polygon.

InputEndpoint.name: clear
InputEndpoint.label: Clear
InputEndpoint.description: Removes all features from the map (points and polygons)
InputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This endpoint does not require any data. When any signal is received on this endpoint, all contents will be removed from the map unconditionally.

OutputEndpoint.name: added_point
OutputEndpoint.label: Added point
OutputEndpoint.description: Whenever a point is added via the map viewer, this event dispatches its coordinates
OutputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: This endpoint dispatches latitude-longitude coordinates whenever a point is added to the map.

OutputEndpoint.name: added_line
OutputEndpoint.label: Added line
OutputEndpoint.description: Whenever a (poly-)line is added via the map viewer, this event dispatches its geometry
OutputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: Whenever a (poly-)line is added via the map viewer, this event dispatches a JSON-encoded object consisting of latitude-longitude coordinates -- ie. latitude-longitude tuples -- this (poly-)line is composed of.

OutputEndpoint.name: added_poly
OutputEndpoint.label: Added polygon
OutputEndpoint.description: Whenever a polygon is added via the map viewer, this event dispatches its geometry
OutputEndpoint.doc:Documentation: Whenever a (poly-)line is added via the map viewer, this event dispatches a JSON-encoded object consisting of latitude-longitude coordinates -- ie. latitude-longitude tuples -- this polygon is composed of.

OutputEndpoint.name: center_point
OutputEndpoint.label: Coordinates
OutputEndpoint.description: Sends a signal whenever the shown center changes

OutputEndpoint.name: ooi_click
OutputEndpoint.label: Clicked object
OutputEndpoint.description: Sends a signal whenever an object is clicked

OutputEndpoint.name: pos_click
OutputEndpoint.label: Clicked spot
OutputEndpoint.description: Sends a signal whenever an empty area of the map is clicked
